text: PKC is Essential in Regulating NF-kappaB Activity

text: As expected in cells transfected with vector control , inhibiting PKC reduced M-CSF - stimulated NF-kappaB activity compared to cells treated with M-CSF and the vehicle DMSO ( p = 0.001 ) ( Figure 8A ) .

In contrast , expressing WT NF-kappaB <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> WT ) increased NF-kappaB activity , while the general PKC inhibitor Ro-31-8220 decreased this NF-kappaB activity ( p = 0.001 ) .

Notably , the introduction of NF-kappaB <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 276 S / A construct significantly reduced NF-kappaB activity compared with the WT NF-kappaB <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> construct ( p = 0.005 ) and M-CSF treatment was unable to overcome this inhibition .
